result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 14CF178, 12CF177, 12CF185, 12TR3440 & 12TR3441. Defendant LeRoy T Parmeter in court with attorney Stephen J Dunlap.  Stephen C Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 8:48 am.  Cannot possess firearm, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot possess body armor.  
12CF177-Count 1-Def-guilty.  CT-adj guilty, NOT enter Judgment-DJOC filed w/ court.  Cont to be bound by non-monetary conditions of bond.  12 mo agreement.  Pay $150 w/in 90 to DA office.  Complete AODA, provide proof & follow thru w/ recommendations.  All other counts, citations, cases are DRI.  9:02 am adj.
from Atty Dunlap to Judge re: agreement in all files
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Defendant shall neither directly or indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.

Defendant LeRoy T. Parmeter in court with attorney Brian T Smestad.  Defendant LeRoy T. Parmeter in custody.  Stephen C Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BAM clerk - 01:31 pm - CASES:  12CF177, 12CF185 & 14CF178 - JA to schedule PH - WSPH - bond continues.  Adj 1:34 pm
